name: Nana's Tuna Puttanesca Sauce with Spaghetti Pasta
author: Diana71
summary: This spicy sauce is made with everything Italian--capers, olives, garlic, tomatoes, anchovies, and hot peppers. Paired with canned tuna and served with spaghetti, this dish will surely lure your entire family to the dinner table.
ingredients: 2 (6 ounce) cans tuna, drained and flaked
½ cup canned diced tomatoes, drained
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes
Drain, reserving about 1/2 cup cooking water
Heat olive oil in medium-sized pot over medium-high heat
Cook and stir onion until it starts turning translucent, 3 to 5 minutes
Add tuna, garlic, cayenne pepper, capers, and olive slices
Stir in tomatoes, herbes de Provence, and anchovy paste
Bring to a boil; reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 20 minutes
If sauce seems too thick, add a few tablespoons of reserved pasta cooking water
